content:
I’ve done a bit of googling and found a couple
https://github.com/funexists/raylean/

  • raylib bindings that use Rust for some odd reason
    https://github.com/KislyjKisel/Raylib.lean

  • more “traditional” raylib bindings
    https://github.com/Anderssorby/SDL.lean

  • SDL bindings (seem abandoned)

I don’t think this is really the same thing, but honorary mention to the Lean Game Server
https://github.com/leanprover-community/lean4game

Has anyone tried any of these? Are there more that I haven’t heard of yet?

On closer inspection, Raylean seems more like a full fledged game engine, including an ECS (!!!!) and a sample game
https://github.com/funexists/jessicacantswim
Haven't tried any of those, but just wanted to say I love the name of that organization, "fun exists"!
indeed, lean4game does not really have anything to do with video games and doesn't use any of the mentioned libraries.
